<<<<<<< HEAD
The new pollecye of warre wherin is declared not only how [ye]mooste cruell tyraunt the great Turke may be ouer come, but also all other enemies of the Christen publique weale, lately deuised by Theodore Basille. Becon, Thomas, 1512-1567.
[164] p.
In Botulphe lane at the sygne of the whyte Beare, by Iohn̄ Maylerre for Iohn̄ Gough, [Imprinted at London : Anno D[omi]ni. 1542]
Theodore Basille = Thomas Becon. Imprint from colophon. Running title reads: The pollecy of warre. Signatures: A-K L² . Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Theodore Basille = Thomas Becon. Imprint from colophon. Running title reads: The pollecy of warre. Signatures: A-K L² . Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
